required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Maintaining Behavior Change: A 6-year Follow-up of Adolescent 'Night-owls'
clinical_study.official_title: Maintaining Behavior Change: A 6-year Follow-up of Adolescent 'Night-owls'

brief_summary.textblock: A follow-up of a cohort of participants recruited for a prior study will be conducted. In the prior study, 10-18 years olds were provided one of two treatments to improve the sleep of adolescent night-owls. The follow-up will be approximately 6-years following participation in the prior study. The goal is to establish long-term outcomes in sleep and circadian functioning, in the five health-relevant domains and in engagement in sleep health behavior.

detailed_description.textblock:
A follow-up of a cohort of participants recruited for a prior study will be conducted. In the prior study, 10-18 years olds were provided one of two treatments to improve the sleep of adolescent night-owls. This follow-up will be approximately 6-years following participation in the prior study. The participants will be 18-28 years of age.
Specific Aim 1: At the 6-year follow-up, participants recruited for the prior study will be assessed for sleep and circadian functioning and functioning in the five health- relevant domains.
Specific Aim 2: The sample will also be assessed for their engagement in sleep health behavior.
This research will advance knowledge on: (a) longer-term outcomes and (b) the role of eveningness as a mechanism contributing to poorer outcomes.

primary_outcome.description: Sum of 13-item; Mix of 4-point and 5-point response scale. Scores can range from 13 (extreme evening) to 55 (extreme morning).

primary_outcome.measure: Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System - Sleep Related Impairment
primary_outcome.description: Sum of 8-items rated on a 5-point response scale. Scores can range from 8 to 40 (Higher score means more Sleep Related impairment)

primary_outcome.measure: Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System - Sleep Disturbance
primary_outcome.description: Sum of 8-items rated on a 5-point response scale. Scores can range from 8 to 40 (Higher score means more Sleep Disturbance)

primary_outcome.measure: Youth Self-Report Composite Score for Emotional domain
primary_outcome.description: A score of Depression, Anxiety, and Stress Scale (DASS) - Sum of 21 item scale, ranging 0-3. Scores can range from 0 to 63 (Higher score means worse outcome).

primary_outcome.measure: Youth Self-Report Score for Cognitive Domain
primary_outcome.description: (Not a scale). A composite score of the Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System -Cognitive Function and the Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System-Cognitive Function - Abilities will be used to assess functioning in the Cognitive domain

primary_outcome.measure: Youth Self-Report Score for Behavioral Domain
primary_outcome.description: (Not a scale) A composite score of the Brief Sensation Seeking Scale, Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System -Alcohol Use, Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System-Severity of Substance Use will be used to assess functioning in the Behavioral domain

primary_outcome.measure: Youth Self-Report Score for Social Domain
primary_outcome.description: (Not a scale) A composite score of the Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System-Companionship, Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System-Emotional Support, Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System-Social Isolation, and Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System-Ability to Participate will be used to assess functioning in the Social domain.

primary_outcome.measure: Youth Self-Report Score for Physical Domain
primary_outcome.description: (Not a scale) A composite score of the Modifiable Activity Questionnaire and Physical Health Questionnaire will be used to assess functioning in the Social domain.
14-item; 1-5 scale. Scores can range from 14 to 70 (Higher score means more utilization).

primary_outcome.measure: Self-Report Behavioral Automaticity Index integrated with the Utilization Scale
primary_outcome.description: 14-item; 1-5 scale. Scores can range from 14 to 70 (Higher score means more automaticity in utilization).

secondary_outcome.description: 19-item. First four items are integer responses. The rest of the items are on a 0-3 scale. The total score can range from 0 to 42. (Higher score means increased severity of difficulty in all sleep area components).
(Not a scale) Night-to-night variability in the mid-point of sleep
(Not a scale) Night-to-night variability in the mid-point of sleep

secondary_outcome.measure: Youth Ecological Momentary Assessment Composite Risk Score of Functioning - Emotional Domain
secondary_outcome.description: (Not a scale) Measured via Ecological Momentary Assessment

secondary_outcome.measure: Youth Ecological Momentary Assessment Composite Risk Score of Functioning - Cognitive Domain
secondary_outcome.description: (Not a scale) Measured via Ecological Momentary Assessment

secondary_outcome.measure: Youth Ecological Momentary Assessment Composite Risk Score of Functioning - Behavioral Domain
secondary_outcome.description: (Not a scale) Measured via Ecological Momentary Assessment

secondary_outcome.measure: Youth Ecological Momentary Assessment Composite Risk Score of Functioning - Social Domain
secondary_outcome.description: (Not a scale) Measured via Ecological Momentary Assessment

secondary_outcome.measure: Youth Ecological Momentary Assessment Composite Risk Score of Functioning - Physical Domain
secondary_outcome.description: (Not a scale) Measured via Ecological Momentary Assessment

other_outcome.measure: Change in Composite Scale of Morningness (CSM)
other_outcome.description: Sum of 13-item; Mix of 4-point and 5-point response scale. Scores can range from 13 (extreme evening) to 55 (extreme morning).

other_outcome.measure: Change in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System - Sleep Related Impairment
other_outcome.description: Sum of 8-items rated on a 5-point response scale. Scores can range from 8 to 40 (Higher score means more Sleep Related impairment)

other_outcome.measure: Change in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System - Sleep Disturbance
other_outcome.description: Sum of 8-items rated on a 5-point response scale. Scores can range from 8 to 40 (Higher score means more Sleep Disturbance)

other_outcome.measure: Change in Depression, Anxiety, and Stress Scale (DASS)
other_outcome.description: Sum of 21 item scale, ranging 0-3. Scores can range from 0 to 63 (Higher score means worse outcome).

other_outcome.measure: Change in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System -Cognitive Function
other_outcome.description: Sum of 6-item; 5-point response scale. Scores can range from 5 to 30 (Higher score means higher cognitive function ).

other_outcome.measure: Change in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System-Cognitive Function - Abilities
other_outcome.description: Sum of 6-item; 5-point response scale. Scores can range from 5 to 30 (Higher score means higher cognitive function and abilities).

other_outcome.measure: Change in Brief Sensation Seeking Scale
other_outcome.description: 8-item; 5-point response scale; Scores can range from 8 to 40 (Higher score means higher sensation seeking).

other_outcome.measure: Change in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System -Alcohol Use
other_outcome.description: Sum of 7-item; 5-point response scale. Scores can range from 7 to 35 (Higher score means higher alcohol use).

other_outcome.measure: Change in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System -Severity of Substance Use
other_outcome.description: Sum of 7-item; 5-point response scale. Scores can range from 7 to 35 (Higher score means higher severity of substance use).

other_outcome.measure: Change in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System - Companionship
other_outcome.description: Sum of 4-item; 5-point response scale. Scores can range from 4 to 20 (Higher score means higher reported companionship).

other_outcome.measure: Change in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System - Emotional Support
other_outcome.description: Sum of 4-item; 5-point response scale. Scores can range from 4 to 20 (Higher score means higher reported emotional support).

other_outcome.measure: Change in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System - Social Isolation
other_outcome.description: Sum of 4-item; 5-point response scale. Scores can range from 4 to 20 (Higher score means higher levels of social isolation).

other_outcome.measure: Change in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System - Ability to Participate in Social Roles & Activities
other_outcome.description: Sum of 4-item; 5-point response scale. Scores can range from 4 to 20 (Higher score means higher ability to participate in Social Roles & Activities).

other_outcome.measure: Change in Modifiable Activity Questionnaire
other_outcome.description: 42-item. Scored by hours per week values and by Metabolic values.

other_outcome.measure: Change in Physical Health Questionnaire
other_outcome.description: Sum of 15-item, 0-2 response scale. Scores can range from 0 to 30 (Higher score means worse physical symptoms)

other_outcome.measure: Height
other_outcome.description: (feet, inches)

other_outcome.measure: Weight
other_outcome.description: Pounds (lbs)

other_outcome.measure: Hip circumference
other_outcome.description: Centimeters (cm)

other_outcome.measure: Waist Circumference
other_outcome.description: Centimeters (cm)

other_outcome.measure: Change in Utilization Scale
other_outcome.description: 14-item; 1-5 scale. Scores can range from 14 to 70 (Higher score means more automaticity in utilization)

other_outcome.measure: Sleep Diary
other_outcome.description: (Not a scale) Consensus sleep diary calculated separately for weekdays and weekends

other_outcome.measure: Actigraphy
other_outcome.description: (Not a scale) calculated separately for weekdays and weekends

other_outcome.measure: Youth Ecological Momentary Assessment Composite Risk Score of Functioning - Emotional Domain
other_outcome.description: (Not a scale) Measured via Ecological Momentary Assessment

other_outcome.measure: Youth Ecological Momentary Assessment Composite Risk Score of Functioning - Cognitive Domain
other_outcome.description: (Not a scale) Measured via Ecological Momentary Assessment

other_outcome.measure: Youth Ecological Momentary Assessment Composite Risk Score of Functioning - Behavioral Domain
other_outcome.description: (Not a scale) Measured via Ecological Momentary Assessment

other_outcome.measure: Youth Ecological Momentary Assessment Composite Risk Score of Functioning - Social Domain
other_outcome.description: (Not a scale) Measured via Ecological Momentary Assessment

other_outcome.measure: Youth Ecological Momentary Assessment Composite Risk Score of Functioning - Physical Domain
other_outcome.description: (Not a scale) Measured via Ecological Momentary Assessment

other_outcome.measure: Sussex-Oxford Compassion Scale (SOCS)
other_outcome.description: Sum of 20-item, 5-point response scale. Scores can range from 20 to 100 (Higher score means higher compassion for self). Sub-scale items included.

other_outcome.measure: Suicidal Behavior Questionnaire - Revised
other_outcome.description: 4-item. Total scores can range from 3-18 (Higher Score means higher Suicidal ideation)

other_outcome.measure: Alexian Brothers Urge to Self Injure Scale
other_outcome.description: 5-item. 0-6 point scale. Total scores can range from 0-30 (Higher Score means higher Suicidal ideation)

study_pop.textblock: Participants will be individuals who participated in a prior treatment study. They will be aged 18 and over.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The inclusion criteria is individuals who participated in a previously-funded behavioral intervention (R01HD071065).
Exclusion Criteria:
- N/A

reference.citation: Harvey AG, Hein K, Dolsen MR, Dong L, Rabe-Hesketh S, Gumport NB, Kanady J, Wyatt JK, Hinshaw SP, Silk JS, Smith RL, Thompson MA, Zannone N, Blum DJ. Modifying the Impact of Eveningness Chronotype ("Night-Owls") in Youth: A Randomized Controlled Trial. J Am Acad Child Adolesc Psychiatry. 2018 Oct;57(10):742-754. doi: 10.1016/j.jaac.2018.04.020. Epub 2018 Aug 15.

clinical_study.keyword: Risk: Emotional, Cognitive, Behavioral, Social, Physical
